insa.h4401.controller

Class ModelManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • insa.h4401.controller.ModelManager

  • public class ModelManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the model of the application, it is responsible of instanciating objects of the model and guarantee model's consistency
    Author:
    Lisa, Estelle, Antoine, Pierre, Hugues, Guillaume, Paul

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Clears the Model.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ModelManager getInstance()
        Returns:
        The instance of the ModelManager in the application, which is a Singleton.

      • initModelMap

        public java.lang.String initModelMap(MapDocument mapDoc)
        Initializes model's Map with the given MapDocument.
        Parameters:
        mapDoc - MapDocument used to fill Map object.
        Returns:
        An error message if a map already exists in the model or if the integrity of MapDocument is compromised, else it will return null.

      • initModelPlanning

        public java.lang.String initModelPlanning(PlanningDocument planDoc)
        Initializes model's Planning with the given PlanningDocument.
        Parameters:
        planDoc - PlanningDocument used to fill Planning object
        Returns:
        An error message if a map doesn't exists in the model or if a planning already exists in the model. It also returns an error message if the integrity of the PlanningDocument is compromised, else it will return null.

      • clearModel

        public void clearModel()
        Clears the Model.

      • clearPlanning

        public void clearPlanning()
        Clears the planning.

      • getMap

        public Map getMap()
        Returns:
        The model's map, currently managed by the ModelManager.

      • getPlanning

        public Planning getPlanning()
        Returns:
        The model's planning, currently managed by the ModelManager.
